param.name: appliance_hostname
param.doc: Host name of the appliance.

param.name: policy_id
param.doc: The system-assigned policy ID value.

method.name: PUT
method.doc: To update the settings of an existing policy, issue an HTTP PUT command on the authentication policies resource URI that specifies the ID of the policy to be updated.
Do not use this command to update the policy content; only modifications that are made to the policy content using the Policy Editor on the appliance local management interface (LMI) are supported.
Submit the policy content in the form of payload elements:
1. Issue an HTTP GET command on the authentication policies resource URI that specifies the policy ID of the policy that is to be updated.
2. Make a copy of the response payload.
3. Update the items as needed, except for the 'policy' element, which contains the policy content.
4. Use the updated payload as the data for the PUT command to avoid inadvertent modifications to the policy content.
For policies with the value "predefined" set to
true, only the "enabled" property can be changed.

request.doc: To determine the policy_id value of the policy to be updated, issue an HTTP GET command on the policies resource URI: https://{appliance_hostname}/iam/access/v8/authentication/policies/.

param.name: Authorization: Basic
param.doc: Basic authentication header.

param.name: Accept:application/json
param.doc: Required for requests to the service.

param.name: name
param.doc: Specify a unique name for the authentication policy.

param.name: policy
param.doc: Configured policy content that uses the specified authentication policy dialect. This is represented as a single-escaped character string.

param.name: uri
param.doc: Specify a unique identifier for the authentication policy.

param.name: description
param.doc: Description of the authentication policy. Note: You can edit this.

param.name: dialect
param.doc: Authentication policy specification used to format the authentication policy. The only valid value is "urn:ibm:security:authentication:policy:1.0:schema". Note: You cannot edit this once you specify it.

param.name: id
param.doc: Internally assigned ID value of the authentication policy.

param.name: userlastmodified
param.doc: User ID of the user who last made modifications to the authentication policy.

param.name: lastmodified
param.doc: Specifies the date and time stamp that the authentication policy was last modified. The string is formatted as a JSON date which has the same format as the ISO-8601 standard: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ.

param.name: datecreated
param.doc: Specifies the date and time stamp that the authentication policy was created. The string is formatted as a JSON date which has the same format as the ISO-8601 standard: YYYY-MM-DDTHH:mm:ss.sssZ.

param.name: predefined
param.doc: Set to True if the authentication policy is predefined and ships with the product. Set to False if the authentication policy is custom defined.

param.name: enabled
param.doc: True if the policy is enabled and invocable at runtime. Set to false to disable the policy. If the policy is disabled it cannot be used by context based access.
